macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Chinese Markets Surge with A-Shares and Hang Seng Leading Gains
items.summary: Shanghai Composite rose 1.09%, Shenzhen 1.75%, GEM 1.82%; Hang Seng up 1.44% to 26,608, Tech Index +3.1% on AI and tech momentum. Nasdaq China Golden Dragon Index surged 4.2% with Alibaba +10%, Bilibili +9%, XPeng +8%.[1]

items.title: US Indices Close Higher; Earnings Season Kicks Off with Bank Reports
items.summary: Dow +0.17%, S&P 500 +0.16%, Nasdaq +0.26%; JPMorgan and Delta earnings due pre-market alongside December CPI data, expected to drive volatility. Focus on core inflation and corporate profits justifying high valuations.[1][4]

items.title: US Markets Hit Record Highs in First Full Week of 2026
items.summary: S&P 500 +1.6%, Nasdaq 100 +2.2%, Russell 2000 +4.6% for the week; Dow and S&P closed at historic highs with broadening rally beyond tech mega-caps. YTD: Russell +5.7%, Dow +3.0%, Nasdaq 100 +1.8%, S&P +1.8%.[2][3][5]

items.title: US CPI Data and Q4 Earnings Season Dominate Tuesday Agenda
items.summary: December US CPI release at 16:30 MSK could spark volatility in dollar, yields, and equities; core inflation slowdown may boost stocks, high print risks Fed policy debate. JPMorgan, Delta reports to set tone for banks and transport.[4]

items.title: Hang Seng Tests Breakout Levels Amid Stabilizing China Flows
items.summary: HSI down 0.4% last week after early surge but holds 26,000 support with constructive technicals; southbound flows resume, China Life +9% on policy bets. Potential retest of 27,200-27,300 resistance.[2]

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Trades Sideways Near $91,000 Amid Options Volatility Spike
items.summary: Bitcoin's spot price remains stuck around $91,000 with low volume and weakening momentum, but options markets show spiking short-term implied volatility, signaling traders bracing for a sharp move and rising demand for downside protection.[6][7]

items.title: BTQ Technologies Launches Bitcoin Quantum Testnet
items.summary: BTQ Technologies has launched the first quantum-safe Bitcoin testnet fork, replacing ECDSA with NIST-standardized ML-DSA to protect against quantum threats, highlighting risks to $650–750 billion in vulnerable BTC including Satoshi's holdings.[4]

items.title: JPMorgan to Issue JPM Coin on Canton Network
items.summary: JP Morgan announced it will launch its USD-backed stablecoin JPM Coin on the privacy-focused Canton Network, expanding from Base as part of plans for regulated, interoperable digital money across multiple blockchains.[2]

items.title: Senate Delays Markup on Major Crypto Legislation
items.summary: Senate Agriculture Chair John Boozman delayed a markup on key cryptocurrency legislation to allow bipartisan talks to continue, amid discussions on related probes in Senate Banking.[6]

items.title: Crypto Markets Flat as Upcoming Macro Week Looms
items.summary: Crypto prices consolidated with minimal movement, including a 0.7% dip in top10 index, ahead of a high-impact week of FOMC speeches, CPI, PPI, jobless claims, and Fed balance sheet data expected to drive volatility.[2][3][5]

items.title: Zcash Plunges 14% After Key Developer Team Quits
items.summary: Privacy token Zcash dropped 14% following the exit of a major developer team over governance disputes.[2]

items.title: Morgan Stanley Files for Bitcoin and Solana ETFs
items.summary: Wall Street firm Morgan Stanley has filed for Bitcoin and Solana ETFs, signaling growing institutional interest.[2]

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Penn State Researchers Develop ZENN AI Framework for Complex Data Analysis
items.summary: Penn State researchers introduced ZENN (Zentropy-Embedded Neural Networks), a new AI framework that adapts to variations in data quality from different instruments, with applications in Alzheimer's research and materials design. The study was featured in the Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences.[1]

items.title: Freenome Expands AI and Deep Learning with NVIDIA for Multi-Cancer Detection
items.summary: Freenome announced expanded AI initiatives accelerated by NVIDIA, including a fragment-level deep learning model for analyzing large cfDNA datasets from blood draws to improve personalized cancer detection. The collaboration also explores AI tools for healthcare organizations using real-world data.[2]

items.title: Meta Announces 'Meta Compute' AI Infrastructure Initiative
items.summary: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg unveiled 'Meta Compute,' a decade-long plan to build tens of gigawatts of AI infrastructure, backed by massive investments including $600 billion in U.S. data centers by 2028 and acquisitions like Scale AI. The initiative is led by former Google and Safe Superintelligence executives.[5]

items.title: OpenAI Acquires Healthcare Startup Torch for ChatGPT Health
items.summary: OpenAI acquired Torch, a startup that unifies lab results, medications, and provider visit recordings, to enhance its ChatGPT Health platform with integrated healthcare data capabilities.[7]

items.title: WEF Survey: AI Drives Cybersecurity Changes, Security Checks Double in 2026
items.summary: A World Economic Forum survey found 94% of respondents view AI as the top cybersecurity driver in 2026, with 64% now assessing AI tool risks before deployment—nearly double from last year—amid rising vulnerabilities.[4]

items.title: Plume Acquires Sweepr to Expand AI-Based Customer Care
items.summary: Networking firm Plume acquired Ireland-based Sweepr, an AI startup serving Telus and Eir, to bolster AI-driven customer care capabilities.[9]

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Hytale Launches in Early Access Today After Years of Development Delays
items.summary: Hytale, the highly anticipated sandbox RPG from Hypixel Studios, enters Early Access on January 13, 2026, at times including 7:00 AM PT / 10:00 AM ET, with expectations of over 1 million players causing potential server queues. Developers urge pre-downloading the launcher to ease launch stress following the project's revival under a co-founder.[2][3][4]

items.title: Magic Forge Tycoon Releases Today Kicking Off Light Week 3 Schedule
items.summary: Magic Forge Tycoon, a strategy management sim, launches on January 13 as the first of several indie and mid-tier games this week, including JRPG The Legend of Heroes: Trails beyond the Horizon and horror title BrokenLore: UNFOLLOW on January 16. The early 2026 schedule highlights smaller studios amid a lack of AAA blockbusters.[1]

items.title: Krafton Invests $68.5 Million in KPop Demon Hunters Music Producer
items.summary: South Korean game publisher Krafton announces up to 100 billion won ($68.5 million) investment in The Black Label, soundtrack producer for the award-winning Netflix animated feature KPop Demon Hunters, which won two Golden Globes.[5]

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Wing Partners with Walmart for Nationwide Drone Delivery Expansion
items.summary: Alphabet's Wing drone delivery service announced expansion to 150 more Walmart stores, reaching 40 million people starting in Houston on January 15, with Google CEO Sundar Pichai predicting a big year ahead as it challenges Amazon.

items.title: Canon Showcases 156dB Dynamic Range SPAD Sensor Prototype at CES 2026
items.summary: Canon's new SPAD sensor prototype offers unprecedented 156dB dynamic range, excelling in high-contrast and low-light scenarios, with potential future integration into consumer products.

items.title: Lenovo Unveils Legion Pro Rollable Gaming Laptop Concept
items.summary: Lenovo's Legion Pro Rollable Concept expands from 16-inch to 24-inch display for esports, featuring a dual-motor tension-based design with minimal vibration.

items.title: Samsung Launches 13-inch Color E-Paper Display at NRF 2026
items.summary: Samsung introduced a compact 13-inch battery-powered Color E-Paper display for retail, offering low power consumption and high visibility for promotional uses in stores.

items.title: ARM, Qualcomm, Samsung Confirm PC and Mobile Price Hikes for 2026
items.summary: Major chipmakers ARM, Qualcomm, and Samsung announced price increases for PCs and mobile devices due to data centers monopolizing global RAM supplies.

items.title: Hong Kong Showcases 61 Tech Companies at CES 2026
items.summary: 61 Hong Kong tech firms demonstrated products at CES 2026, highlighting the region's potential for global markets.
